author: trewerd
title: Smaller Mask; Bigger Sword
review:
The Toa Mata of Fire is back... sort of. With little over half of the pieces the original Tahu had, this "scaled down" version still manages to more poseable.

The Look: Using different pieces, it pulls off the "Tahu Look" quite well.

The Mask: The same mask as before, but smaller and designed to fit on an Av-Matoran head, as well as Metru heads.

The Weapon: The flame sword found on Glatorian Legends Ackar, but with a bit more paint blended in, so it looks like fire. MUCH wider than the original Tahu sword, but about an inch longer.

Pros: 
-MORE POSEABLE THAN THE ORIGINAL
-Able to fit into canister without the need to remove weapons and armor
-Mask doesn't fall off easily.
-Includes Golden version of the mask
-Cooler looking weapon (more of an opinion really)

Cons: 
-About the same price as the original was back in 2001, but containing 
a lot less pieces.
-Small mask cannot fit a Toa Mata head.
-Arms are solid, pre-bent pieces, making it look awkward.
-Av-Matoran head (see through, making the whole face show light, rather than the mata heads in which light only shows in the eyes.

All things considered, it's a nice little representation of the character. Not a bad toy, but for 5 dollars more, you could get the larger Glatorian sets which feature more poseablility, and all in all, more pieces.

author: reidak49
title: He's back (so am I)
review:
hey!, cool the original Tahu is back
he somewhat looks like his original self it even has his old mask its pretty sweet i should pick it up if i have the chance i kind of want his old sword back but Lego has done a good job at making Tahu look like his old self
geeze I feel like im getting old.

author: captain_radda_radda
title: A great way to end the Bionicle saga
review:
As we all know, the Bionicle saga ends in January. How ironic that the first toa I ever got would also end up being the last. For an $8 set, the size isn't bad. The flame sword is awesome and looks ten times better than the origanal. I really like the mix of red and orange because of the new red plates added on to the arms. Although the red fists are nice, I think it would have been cool to take the origanal "hands" instead. The mask is now modernized and even looks slightly elongated. The fact that Lego added his golden mask was brilliant as I never owned the origanal. 

Pros:
- Its tahu for crying out loud
- The set is modified to fit the new standards, but kina looks wierd when compared to the old tahu
- Flame Sword

Cons:
- Kinda short
- Tahus eyes werent green and the face part the was given does not match the set. 

Overall:
A wonderful tribute to the icon of bionicle. Its worth it if you've seen the whole series, but isn't as meaningful to those noobs out there. Guys trust me, even with its flaws, its worth it.

author: peahats
title: Bionicle Stars: Tahu
review:
A very simple Bionicle set. Tahu is mainly red and orange with green eyes. He comes with a large flame sword. Tahu comes package with the mask of the golden bionicle. He also serves as the base for the golden bionicle.

Pros:
1 nicely painted flame sword
2 good color scheme 
3 worth the price
4 inexpensive 

Cons:
1 cannot bend knees or elbows 
2 golden bionicle mask is the same as Tahu's mask

author: SWfreak
title: Is it a good ending or a bad one?
review:
Personally I think the first one is better but this one has still got some good parts.

cons:

non-flexible arms (I can't stand it in combination with those hands!)
green eyes (since when are non possessed toa mata eyes green!?)
why does he have nuva armor at the back of his sword!?

pros:

ackar's sword in a less pricey set
new feet
new armor
new mask
gold mask

If your a die hard bionicle fan (like myself) then you should try and finish strong with the last six sets.

author: KJM72
title: Well... It's Not The Best...
review:
(This review comes from my LEGO.com Account)

Tahu isn't the best set there is.

His sword is a little awkward because of the pre-bent arms and the large size of the sword itself. However, the sword is in a new color: orange blended with red. The colors are nice, because orange is a relatively rare color in Bionicle sets. The new armor pieces are quite nice.

One of the worst parts of Tahu is the head. It juts out way to far and adds to the awkward appearance that the completed set has. His mask doesn't fit on a 2004-2008 head, which ruins an otherwise cool mask. The gold mask included suffers from the same problems that the red mask has. It's too small, and seemingly useless because of the fact that it only fits on the weird head included in the set.

One of the best parts if the set is the new feet.

.:Pros:.
-Nice armor
-Orange
-Newly colored sword
-feet

.:Cons:.
-Awkward arms+large sword= (>_<)
-Head juts out and adds to the bad look
-Mask only fits on bad head
-Gold mask suffers from the same problems
Overall, Tahu is okay. Is he worth it? Sure, if you want the pieces to make your own creations. If you just want the set to display, wait until it goes on sale. $8 USD is too much money when you take into consideration that the set looks... bleh. I would recommend Gresh Stars instead.
Thanks for reading!

author: deadtree103
title: A worthy finish.
review:
The stupidest decision in the history of stupid decisions was for lego to end Bionicle. But I'm not going to rant about that here.

THE CAN
Despite being small sets, the Stars are packed in little cans that are about the same height as a Glatorian Legends Canister, and surprisingly, there isn't too much empty space in them. On the front there is a nice CGI image of Tahu, who seems to be standing in the middle of a desert with a Hau background, plus the regular peice count and the normal legal text.(Heres a hint, never pay attention to the age limit, but the age requirement can be used as an excuse in the right circumstances)Turning it around to the back, and see the BIO code(Wich is Go Tahu in Leet), the picture advertising the other Stars and how they Each have a gold armor peice used on Tahu, and finally a picture of Tahu going into his can for storage. There is also a nice Skrall sheild design on top.

THE CONTENTS OF THE CAN
I'll start off with the instruction book, yes, you heard me right, this version does have an instruction BOOK. Nothing spectacular though, but there is an ad for Ben 10(Grr)and a new acnielsen ad thats in green with some ten year old dork with his mouth open looking like hes constipated, theres also a pile of box corners on one side. 11 out of the 19 parts are either new peices or recolors, and the new feet and armor should be useful in MOCing, because the feet have an axle hole on the bottom, making it very useful for chest armor. The Gold Hau seems to be a third type of gold, its not as dark as the 01-05 gold, but its not as bright as the 06-09 gold, and it looks really good, like natural gold.

THE SET
Not really that much to say really, just the standard nine points of articulation for an Agori/ Av-matoran build.

OVERALL
I'll list the pros and cons now.

PROS :)
*Lots of recolors and new parts.
*new gold.
*New armor peices.
*Awesome canister.
*ITS FREAKING TAHU!

CONS :(
*New Acneilsen ad sucks . . . . .Hard.
*Av-matoran build.
*Did I mention that the acneilsen ad sucks?

Overall, I think it was definitely worth the 11 bucks I paid for him.

author: michaelvader
title: THE GOLDEN TAHU!
review:
Yes I know I already did a review on this guy but this time since I have all the stars..... I HAVE ALL 6 GOLDEN ARMOR PIECES! So I put them on it it is the best thing I ever saw. (not really but it rocks)!

The Gold Mask: Of cores the best part is the mask. Though its a darker gold then I thought but that dose not matter. 5/5

The Gold Chest And Arm Pieces(3x): They are new pieces IN GOLD! Whats not to like about this well these pieces. They look like alien tech or something. 5/5

The Shield: This is the worst piece. It can't really "block" anything. and it gets in the way on the arm. I would rather have something besides this. 4/5

The Golden Sword Thing. I really like this piece but there is not much to say about it. 5/5

Overall All The stars are worth it and all the golden pieces. God Bless.

100,000,000/5

author: trust351
title: Lookin good...but not too good
review:
I love Tahu,but not THIS Tahu. Before LEGO relased this set,i'm waiting long,long time. And today i've get this set. I build this and... Okay...

Pros:
Hau
Golden Hau
Fire blade
Box
Legs

Cons:
Av-Matoran head
LEGO Ben 10 ad (i like Ben 10 but in BIONICLE instruction...)

Overall

4

author: CityCaretaker6213
title: Blast from the Past!
review:
This Tahu set might have the +rod Hau I've been waiting for quite the time, but it's not the legendary set of the theme we've been waiting for to blast the evil simple torsos.

But first, I'd start with the pros, like most people.

Pros:
* Legendary Kanohi
* Awesome blade
* Additional Golden Hau, for those not in favor of red
* Armor

And here were the cons I was talking (or typing) about.

Cons:
* Simple Av-torso
* Un-bendable arms
* Nuva shoulder pad?
* Wish it was Canister-sized
* Spiked feet rehaul
* Av-toran head

As you can see, I give it a 3 because the set was disappointing.

author: CadKatarn14
title: Very Nice
review:
I recently just got this set for Christmas. I think it is a nice way to end the Bionicle theme. He is one of my favorite sets in Bionicle history. I have collected as many forms of Tahu as possible since he is my favorite Toa. I like the Golden Hau that this set comes with. It is a very nice shade of gold. Probably the best shade there can be. I have also recieved all of the Stars and created the Tahu in the Golden Bionicle form. I seem to like him better in this form. But anyways, onto the review:

Set:

Pros:
2 Haus!
Tahu
Different colored Flame sword
Nice Orange and Red Shade like the old Tahu Mata

Cons:
-Has a green head/eyes from the Av-Matoran sets, makes him look strange and you can't really point out his eyes, you only see a bunch of green
-Random Silver Nuva Shoulder armor with sword, should be orange or red
- Too Small, could have been a bit bigger, Tahu, and the masks

Canister:

Pros:
Nice Skrall sheild on top
Hau in background is very nice

Cons:
None

Instructions:
They are very nice, it is not a hard build. There is an image that reminds me of the good old days of Bionicle on the first page with all the stars on it with a Hau on the background and Golden Tahu with his Flame Sword in the Air. Unfortunately, it has an ad for Ben10.

 Possibly the best bionicle set of the year.

author: benjadude11
title: long time no see
review:
When I heard that stars were the last bionicles coming out, I immediatly rushed to get as many as I could. I got all six. I was especially excited about Tahu.

Before I show you the pros and cons, I want to say something. This Tahu is almost exactly the same height as the original Tahu. Go figure, right?

Pros: 
good color scheme (i'm not crazy about the orange chest plate, but hey) 
sweet sword
posable and expressive
a fitting member to the bionicle All-Star team. (heck, he would be captain.)

Cons:
mask isn't wide enough
head under mask looks stupid

Lucky readers, it's two-in-one day for reviews. Here is my bonus review of the golden bionicle.

Pros:
really good color scheme
gold is kind of dark, it looks like real gold
sweeter sword
posable and expressive
a good choice for golden bionicle. He was the first, and now he'll be the last. *sob* 

Cons: 
shield is tiny, gets in the way 
mask isn't wide enough
head under mask looks stupid

Okay, so maybe I got a little repeatetive there, but y'know, it's late, I'm a lazy bum, etc. etc.

author: LEGOwikiguy
title: The final Tahu and defends the Golden Mask...
review:
I must admit, this is a really good first Bionicle Stars set! An easy build (19 pieces, not bad), great posability, and goes very well with the Stars' Skrall. A little too pricy for the set alone, but I still do recommend this set. Pros and Cons, sir!

Pros:

1. Very posable

2. Goes well with the Skrall

3. Golden parts are built onto this model

4. Flame sword is long and pretty cool looking!

Cons:

1. Small for price

2. Alone, nothing really to do except pose it. DO NOT BUY THIS SET ALONE!

I must admit, this is a good set when compared with Pros and Cons. Parents: This requires your child to study every detail in build, or this set will have to be restarted. My advice, help your child out if they need help. If you can't, see if you can have a brother/sister/parent help build it with them, especially when connecting parts.

4/5 is my rating. Hope this review helps all those Bionicle Stars fans who druel at the sight of this beauty.

author: Bioniclebuilder810
title: Mid "Star" Rating
review:
Tahu is my favorite Bionicle set, but is the smallest one
in my collection. Tahu has a mid-star rating. 

Pros:
1. Flame Sword
2. Mask of Shielding
3. Golden Mask
4. Bright Colors

Cons:
1. Hard to take apart the 2 foot pieces
2. To get all the golden pieces, you have to buy all other sets with it
3.Gold Shield covers whole right arm

author: whiffy5
title: Last of the Bionicles
review:
Sadly, this is one of the six last Bionicles. Here are the pros and cons:

Pros:

  • gold piece
  • fire sword
  • armor

Cons:

  • pieces break easily
  • way simpler than the old Tahu

If you are a fan of Bionicles, try to buy these. They are gone in I think 2011.

author: kenbuild
title: An OK Set
review:
They did a bad job of representing the original Tahu. The way they tried  to make the fire sword was really bad. All though Lego did a bad job at recreating Tahu, they still made the set a fun set to play with.

Pros, It's fun to play with. 

Cons, bad sword, Bad body represetation of originall, and mask is not compatible with original Tahu

author: kaboomlegoman
title: Awesome!
review:
This is a really cool set. The new Hau is like the original.


Building: Well, this is pretty straightfoward for an 8 dollar set. ( I know I spelled straightfoward wrong, I'm not looking in a dictionary though.) (It probably doesn't exist.) But some cool pieces.


Pieces: Amazing. Something could've been better for the hand cover. (I actually wouldn't have liked any at all) but I like TLC using the original again. Golden Hau rocks, and new Hau is an okay remake to the original.


Playability: It's just one action figure, so meh. But combined with other Bionicles ( I have the whole 2009 set) It contains massive fun. Massive.


Price: Yeah, but for a Bionicle this is the standard price.


Overall: Really great set. I hope to collect the other stars and put the golden pieces on this guy.

author: Kalhiki
title: Does he live up to his original version?
review:
Does this set really live up to the original Tahu? Lets find out.

BUILDING EXPERIENCE - Seriously, we've seen this build since 2008. I'm not going over it. Building wasn't that fun, new, or exciting. They did however add some parts to it like the armor to make him look a little different from your average Agori or Av-Matoran. But really, nothing new.

PARTS - You get a new Hau! Sadly it doesn't fit on the old Toa Mata head, but I don't think many people really use that head very much in MoCing. But if you wanted to put it on the original Tahu, you can't. The fire sword is a nice blend of red and orange making it look more fiery. And there's also all the cool armor pieces that adds a little more to the figure. The feet are also cool and make him stand well.

PLAYABILITY AND POSEABILITY - Do to the arms and legs being solid pieces, you don't have any knee or elbow movement. But you can get him in a number of decent poses. He is overall more poseable than the original Tahu. As far as Playability, he's fun to fight the Rahkshi, Skrall, and Piraka, but it's even more fun when you give him the ...

GOLDEN ARMOR - When you get all the Stars sets, you can upgrade Tahu by switching the armor out with the gold pieces. He still looks good in this form, but I would have liked to see some armor on the legs. With the armor, he looks like he can take on anything that comes at him.

ANYTHING ELSE? - There's not much else. I do like that they gave him a bottom for his sword. But I don't like the head. The original problem with it is that it sticks out pretty far from his body. also, the way the mask hooks up, it leaves a piece of the head visible giving him a chin. Or a beard. And if you don't like the fact about lack of poseability in some areas, remember, the original didn't have that either.

OVERALL AND VALUE - I do recommend him. He does, for the most part, live up to his original self and it is a good updated version. For eight dollars, I do think it is a good deal. Tahu was an iconic character and this does not dissapoint.

author: Alemas
title: Tahu's back!
review:
Overview

Tahu was originally launched in 2001, the first year of Bionicle. In 2002 he transformed into Tahu Nuva. 6 years later, in 2008, Tahu made a comeback as a Mistika. And now, in 2010, the final year of Bionicle, Tahu returns almost as he started: With the original Hau mask.

Building Experience

Um, WHAT building experience? This took me... 1 minute to build. WAY too quick. However, snapping all the parts together is fun. 2/5

Parts

We have good a selection. We have a Hau mask, a GOLD Hau mask, and a flame sword! HOWEVER, the Hau masks have an axle hole in them, unlike the original version, and they don't fit in the original head block! Loses a point for that. 4/5

Playability

Ouch. The fixed limbs limits posability a lot! It's almost unbearable! However, if you get all the other sets from the "Stars" line, you get a gold piece in each set, which you can put on Tahu! 3/5

Value for Money

£6.99 for this? Not so good. 3/5

Overall

Not so good. The fixed limbs damages playability, but the Hau masks are good, and you get a cool flame sword! But overall, not recommended unless you want the Hau masks or want to collect all of the 2010 Bionicle sets! 3/5
Alemas

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE - Toa Star Tahu
review:
The Toa Star Tahu set (7116) is a LEGO BIONICLE set which came out in 2010. It comes with 0 minifigs and 19 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7116-1.jpg[/img]


Toa Star Tahu:

Toa Star Tahu is the red toa who appears for the last time before BIONICLE ends. The arms, the hands, the feet, the legs and the head can be moved and you get a golden mask. If you collect all 6 BIONICLE Stars sets you'll get a golden armor for Toa Tahu. It does remind me of one of those special armors from the Power Rangers TV show which was supposed to be only for the red ranger (I've forgotten the name of the special armor).

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Nice starter set
Price
Design
No stickers

Negative:

No minifigs

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: TBOC
title: Tahu Mata, Toa of Fire.
review:
Toa Tahu Mata, back in his original form.

Why? Because the mask of life devolved it, It think they were too lazy to make him Nuva, Have a problem with that? Well go complain to the Ignika.

Pros:

  • New armour pieces.
  • Gold Hau, Used as Golden armour piece, NOT AN ACTUAL GOLD HAU.

Cons:

  • Av-Matoran head, Terrible......
  • Av-Matoran design. Enough said.
  • Sword. It annoys me so much, why is it so big and unconrtoled? Nothing like the ACTUAL Tahu's.
  • Sword hilt, why silver? It ruins the colour scheme.
  • His Hau. It is so small and doesn't fit on a Mata head, or really a Metru head.

8/10.

author: handsome_skellington
title: Amazing!
review:
I got this set for Valentine's day. When I got it, I was amazed. This BIONICLE from 2001, is back! So, let's get to the pros and cons!

PROS
Old mask
gold mask
awesome blade!
new shoulder armor
good playability
good value for money


CONS
Mask is small
not that many pieces



Overall: Great set!

author: ceroknight
title: A Leg Piece Was Missing.....
review:
Like the title says, a whole leg piece was missing...but that is not going to make me judge this set bad, because I got it from customer's service. Also, i don't like how this version of Tahu is tiny compared to the phantoka version..Anyways, I will divide this into Building Experience, Parts, Playability and Value of Money

Building Experience: What can I say? It is worse than building a impulse pack that is HALF the price! I didn't bother even looking at the instructions, and the only reason I got this was because this is the last Tahu for my collection.

Parts: The parts, in my opinion, are too big and bulky making it hard to make it hard to MOC with

I don't like the arms because 90 degrees joint and there is no cross on each side so its kinda hard to put other armor. However I like the armor it is given but still bulky. Another reason I got this set was for the golden kanohi. I remembered how many packs of konohi masks I have been through to get one of these :-P Too bad you can't put it on other faces...Lovely flame though

Playabilty: Little because of the prejointed everything.

Value Of Money: Like I said, I would rather get two impulse sets instead.... By the way, the original Tahu was less than this and had better...everything

Looks like I didn't need the missing leg to affect my judgement...Bionicle made me start buying Lego..too bad they had to end it...with these sets too...Not the best Lego...

author: Toa_Haprik
title: Tahu Is He Still a Legendary Toa?
review:
Tahu Is in Special edition size and the golden armour is a nice touch to finish bionicle because it ends this year.

so first the new mouth part for the mask is good , new feet excellent , agori & av matoran parts ... no , new sword alright & a vintage look awseome.

the price is not so good £6.99 is £1.00 cheaper than glatorian price and £3.00 more than agori so it should be £4.99

rating is 4/5 due to price.

overall a good set

author: KodakKid365
title: It's Tahu so what can I say?
review: Okay, Tahu isn't to bad, considering that he is a midgit with arms and legs that are  basicly to short to move. The thing that is amazing is the fire sword. It's toataly fabulous! Yah so Tahu is pretty cool, aside from the fact that he's Tahu of course.

author: Mandalorian
title: The legendary Tahu returns
review:
Tahu returns for the fourth time, however with only nineteen pieces. The best part of this set, except for the fact that it's Tahu, is that the sword is really cool and beautifully glows in the light.
Pros:
  • It's Tahu!
  • Two versions of the Hau
  • Fun to play with
  • Not too expensive
  • Very cool sword (much nicer than any other fire sword)
Cons:
  • Not much of a build
  • The silver piece seems out of place
  • Only nineteen pieces.
Get Tahu if you want to, or if you don't have a Tahu yet. But if you don't get him it will not be much of a loss.
  •

author: Odeinoichus
title: Bionicle No Clever Title this time.
review:
Set #7116 Bionicle Stars Tahu: The end of an era is marked by six sets from the beginning of this year known as the Bionicle Stars, each one a representation of one of the factions from this beloved Technic theme, each one including a Golden Bionicle Piece to turn Tahu into the Golden Toa... And each one is well worth the price they are offered for because they are, after all, Bionicle versions of the Impulse sets.

 

I got a great deal this past weekend on three of the six, getting them for 5$ each on sale and I am not dissapointed with that in the slightest, even at full price these little sets can be highly enjoyable.

 

Tahu is built using Technic pieces that I am not as familiar with as some of the older pieces - it is a simple to build model with very few pieces and once he's done he looks a little shorter than past Bionicle offerings, but that's ok. Why? Because these sets aren't supposed to be to scale, they're supposed to be cheap anniversary sets offered by LEGO to prove that Bionicle wasn't for nothing.

 

I particularly prefer the smaller scale because it's much easier to display all of my Bionicle figures and store them now, the cases that they come in are quite good for easy storage compared to the rounder tubes of the original Toa. I also prefer the weapon piece that Tahu has compared to the older version, this one looks more solid and wider compared to the original Tahu's flame.

 

One last thing, I prefer this version to the original because it doesn't include any gear gimmicks, so that you can pose the figure and not have floppy arm problems due to the gimmick. As far as Bionicle is concerned, I enjoyed it, I didn't follow the whole backstory and such as much as other fans, but it was much better than the old Throwbots Technic line before it. And these Bionicle Stars are a nice little batch of six figures that can stand in my collection to represent one of the hottest selling LEGO products outside of the Star Wars franchise. Will Hero Factory live up to the Bionicle mythos as a new franchise? I don't know, but it's better than letting the Bionicle mythos become so overpopulated that you just can't be bothered with picking up any more new Toa or Villain sub-themes.

author: matoro99
title: Pretty Good...
review:
This set, in my opinion, was only satisfactory. Also, Tahu Star is really a $7.99 matoran or agori that wears a mask of power and carries a sword that looks like fire. But, as far as bionicle goes, it does have some rare peices and you can easily position it and move it around. With that, it's time for pros and cons:

Pros

  • A golden kanohi hau (the first one since 2002)
  • A fire sword piece (you have to admit, it looks better than ackar's)

    Cool arm and chest plate pieces (if you are looking for those, takunuva star is better)

Cons

  • Haven't they already made tahu three other times?
  • The original tahu (2001) was better.
  • What's with the silver handle?
  • He is an original bionicle not a bara magnan. what's with the glatorian hands?
  • He is practically a matoran of light (2008) with a mask of power and a fire shooting weapon.

  Personally, I think tahu in 2001 was better I learned the hard way, you shoulden't have to. Only get Bionicle stars for the golden pieces exept for the rakhshi and piraka they look pretty cool. Tahu Star is a disgrace to Tahu Mata! Only buy Tahu Mata (his arms move)!

author: LEGOSWHP102
title: The Toa of Fire returns as a Super Star
review:
Tahu is back, Bringing a Brilliant, but Sad Closure to the Theme

It is sad to see the BIONICLE theme end, I know it is a little late for that, but let's get to the Review:

 

Tahu as you know has been one of the first six toa heroes back in 2001, and it is great to see him again. This is his fourth variant: Toa Mata, Toa Nuva, Mistika, and Star. All of the BIONICLE Stars have a golden piece, Tahu comes with a Golden Tahu Mask. It is NOT the same as the original one back in 2001, but it is still very nice. As for the head, it is the same one as the Av-Matoran from 2008. It also comes with a new exclusive piece that can only be found in the Stars. It is on his chest and arms and it looks pretty good. The Colors of Tahu are the same as the previous Tahus seen in 2001 and 2002, Bright Red and Orange. Another Exclusive Piece is the feet. As for the Weapon, he only has one weapon, but that is not a problem. It is the same weapon that Ackar has except it has a new color of red and orange mixed together instead of just orange.

 

Every detail from this 19 piece Star is Brilliant, even though it only has 19 pieces.

author: tkettle9719
title: A true Bionicle Star
review:
I got this set at Target for regular price, and am pleased to say that it is the greatest Bionicle in the Stars line.

Pros

  • -Sure, Tahu's been done three times before, but this one is an excellent remake of the original, especially with the new sword.
  • -The golden armor collection, once completed, is just grand and amazing once put on Tahu.
  • …

Cons

  • -I think the sword hilt is fine, but it does look a bit odd.
  • -I also find the loss of functionality hurtful since the original at least had some, even though it was limited.
  • …

This is one of the last Bionicle sets ever made, and will miss the series as a whole. Buy this if you find it at a really low price, and try to find all of the golden pieces if you can. Happy hunting!
